@surper

About the missing 10 minutes runtime. You should note that this rip is from a PAL DVD, i.e. @25 fps. The runtime on iMDB is the theatrical runtime, i.e. where the movie is run @24 fps. This may sound like a joke if it's the first time you hear it, but actually the most used way to convert 24fps to film in Europe and other PAL regions is just speed it up from 24 fps to 25 fps, thus making the movie slightly shorter in terms of runtime (although you're not missing anything as it just runs a little bit faster). This would account for some 10 minutes "missing". Don't worry about it, it's all there :)
Edit: "convert 24fps to film" - of course I meant convert 24fps film to DVD.

I am an Asperger and was very skeptic when downloading this movie as Aspergers Syndrome is kinda hard to make out of someone personality. I found out that the protagonist Rizvan is a High-Functioning Autist and not Asperger like 2 mins into the movie, the director shouldve done his homework on the subject, but i guess it had to look dramatic for the sake of the audience.

That being said, i liked the movie.. it has its flaws but sets some powerful emotions in motion.
